critical_rules: Never access objects after passing to worker thread
Set all callbacks before thread handoff
Cleanup resources in same thread where created

rules: Use DAP_DEL_Z to null pointers after free

when_acceptable: Parameter passed by value (not affecting caller)
Parameter not used for further calculations
Standard pattern in system programming (like read/write syscalls)
input_parameter_modification.example: Modify a_data_size to return actual processed count
input_parameter_modification.rationale: Efficiency over academic purity in system code

targeted_validation.principle: Check only where problems can actually occur
rules: Validate in functions that INCREASE buffer sizes
Skip redundant checks in functions that only DECREASE sizes
Avoid performance penalty of excessive validation
Focus checks on mutation points, not read-only operations
targeted_validation.anti_pattern: Buffer corruption checks in pop/consume functions

variable_reuse: Reuse input parameters as return values when semantically clear
Minimize local variables in hot paths
Prefer stack allocation over heap when possible
stack_efficiency: Use existing variables instead of creating new ones

system_code: Performance and memory efficiency are primary
Input parameter modification is acceptable pattern

error_handling.validation: Check all input parameters for NULL at function start
error_handling.efficiency_first: In system code, validate only where corruption can occur

common_mistakes: Creating unnecessary variables when parameter reuse is cleaner
Buffer validation in wrong places (read-only vs write operations)
performance_considerations: Minimize memory allocations in hot paths
Reuse input parameters as return values when appropriate
Target defensive programming to mutation points only
Prefer stack efficiency over academic code purity in system programming

examples: Input parameter modification for return values
Minimal defensive checks in non-mutating functions

contextual_best_practices.rule: Best practices depend on code context and constraints
